topic: Describing Hobbies and Free Time Activities
introduction:
In this lesson, we will learn how to describe hobbies and free-time activities. We will focus on vocabulary related to activities people do for fun and basic grammatical structures such as the verb 'like' and the Present Simple tense.

Grammar Focus:

  • The verb 'like' to express preferences: 'I like...', 'I don't like...'
  • Using Present Simple for habits: 'I play football every Saturday.'
  • Asking simple questions: 'Do you like swimming?'
presentation:
Vocabulary:

  • Read (books, comics)
  • Play (football, games)
  • Swim
  • Watch (TV, movies)
  • Listen to (music)
  • Cook
  • Dance
  • Travel
  • Paint
  • Sing
  • Hike
  • Draw
  • Exercise
  • Ride (a bike)
  • Write (stories, poems)

Example Sentences:

  • I like to read books.
  • She doesn't like to play football.
  • We swim every Saturday.
  • Do you watch movies?
  • He listens to music in the evening.
conclusion:
Review:

In this lesson, we learned how to talk about hobbies and free-time activities. We practiced using the verb 'like' and the Present Simple tense.

Example Dialogue:

A: What do you like to do in your free time?
B: I like to read books and play games. What about you?
A: I enjoy hiking and listening to music.

Questions for Review:

  • What hobbies do you like?
  • What hobbies do you not like?
  • How do you ask someone about their hobbies?
